bug.short_desc: USB stick restore feature uses incorrect type code, macOS wants to initialize the stick
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Using the restore stick feature results in fdisk type code 83 (Linux) being used instead of either OB or OC. Windows may not recognize type code 83; for sure macOS does not and asks the user to initialize the disk.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): mediawriter-4.0.8-0.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Always. Not a regression.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. After putting a live image on a USB stick, insert it with FMW running. 2. Acknowledge Restore option for the stick. 3.
Actual results:
fdisk type code for the partition created on the stick is 83. macOS recognizes this as a Linux type code and won't mount (automatically or manually) the stick.
Expected results:
Type code should probably be 0B; or possibly 0C. I've tried both on macOS and both work.
Additional info:
Chris, thanks for noticing. I fixed this upstream.
mediawriter-4.1.0-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-dade9f0f49

mediawriter-4.1.0-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-dade9f0f49
mediawriter-4.1.0-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
